Title: A study of the tourism area life cycle in Dieng Kulon village
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Management Department, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan/Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Sahid Institute of Tourism, Jl. Kemiri No. 22, Pondok Cabe, Pamulang, Tangerang Selatan, Banten, 15418, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Setiawan, B., Management Department, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan/Palmerah, Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Wiweka, K., Sahid Institute of Tourism, Jl. Kemiri No. 22, Pondok Cabe, Pamulang, Tangerang Selatan, Banten, 15418, Indonesia
Abstract: This study discusses the potential of the Dieng Kulon Tourism village (central Java province), as one of the National Strategic Tourism Areas in Indonesia, in the areas of attraction, accessibility, amenities, ancillaries, available package and activity. An observation method, was adopted to analyze ‘tourist area life-cycle’ (TALC) model. Additionally, in-depth interviews were subsequently were combined with secondary data. The research results indicated Dieng Kulon tourism village has the potential to develop as a National Strategic Tourism Area, and based on Tourist Area Life Cycle (TALC) model, Dieng Kulon Tourism village is in the development phase. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press.
Author Keywords: Dieng Kulon village; National Strategic Tourism Area; Tourist Area life-cyclep
